context: NASA. National Administration of Stuff and Americuh. Where we use trillions of dollars for...things other than space. replies.context:
Have you no idea what it took to get the James Webb Space Telescope into space.
It is and magnificent technological achievement WAY beyond anything SpaceX will achieve in the next 50 years.

Yea it took $5 billion instead of $500 million of tax payers money. That's just building it and launching it! Plus it's far out in space now so maintaining it is off the table now. Overall the telescope cost is now $9.7 billion. That's an expensive camera. Why aren't we getting new pictures everyday or week? Waste of money and resource. 
$67 million for the Falcon launch. Space X took $400 million to make it aspace organization. Nothing came out of tax payers pockets. Pretty much crushed NASA.
Yeah, and they did it wrong the first time--lowest bidder--and they couldn't see anything. Had to do it again, more $$$$$. NASA just isn't the cutting edge agency it once was. SpaceX is.
